Intergovernmental Conference on an international legally binding i United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea on the conservation and sustainable use of marine biological diversity of areas beyond national jurisdiction session
Agenda item 5: General exchange of views
Statement by the Micronesian delegation
New York, 26 August 2022
Madam President
Thank you, for your hard work and brilliant leadership throughout the IGC process. Our appreciation as well goes to the Bureau Members, the Facilitators and Colleagues in the room who worked hard and contributed meaningfully and constr negotiations.
May I also align this statement with the statements previously made by delegates speaking on behalf of G77 and China, AOSIS and
Madam President,
There is no doubt on the importance of what we try to accomplish in the BBNJ negotiation process. The whole world is watching us interest and anticipation on what we as the conference of in the Ocean will put in place in order t biological diversity of areas beyond national jurisdiction inclusive and transparent manner in which you have
We are of course disappointed that IGC5 has not concluded, successful conclusion of our work when this session reconvenes endorse the way forward you have outlined. was released earlier today. May we ask how you are pla made today, which needs to be captured in order to continue our work when IGC5 resumes?
Thank you.
